description: Borrowed from French cabochon, diminutive form of caboche (“head”), from Old French caboce, from Latin caput (“head”).

entries.meaning: (chiefly attributive) A precious stone which has only been polished, not cut into facets.
examples: Thecla was  […]  stroking a bracelet formed like a kraken, a kraken whose tentacles wrapped the white flesh of her arm; its eyes were cabochon emeralds.
